intro: Scurrula balansae, commonly known as the African sand orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces a distinctive, fragrant scent. Scurrula balansae is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands.
